records.uncertainty_note: Specific location redacted, only country (Bulgaria) is known.

possible_violations.violation_name: Female migrants allegedly beaten by Bulgarian police guard

records.context_note: Female migrants, including a young Iraqi woman, reported being pushed and beaten by a female Bulgarian police guard after being intercepted. Other female migrants also reported similar incidents. An investigation in cooperation with the Host Nation is planned.
records.evidence_quote: Female migrants allegedly beaten by Bulgarian police guard

records.uncertainty_note: Specific facility redacted, only country (Bulgaria) is known.

possible_violations.violation_name: Allegations on violation of Fundamental Rights

records.context_note: A Syrian migrant claimed that after apprehension, a policeman took him to the WC, asked for money, took his phone, and punched him in the neck. The migrant declined to report officially.
records.evidence_quote: This policeman punched him on the back side of the migrants neck.

records.location_details: Operational Area of JO EPN Minerva, inside port of Ceuta
records.location_text_raw: Operational Area of JO EPN Minerva, inside port of Ceuta
records.context_note: Two MAR nationals, claiming to be minors, were found hiding in a truck in the port of Ceuta. A CNP officer handcuffed them and hit them in the face twice. Frontex personnel intervened. Internal procedures against the officer have been initiated, and the migrants were taken to a Children Protection Centre.
records.evidence_quote: The CNP officer hit the migrants in the face twice.

records.context_note: An Iraqi national reported multiple attempts to cross borders. In one instance, he claimed Bulgarian police apprehended his group, took their cell phones and money (around 2000€), and told them to walk towards what they said was Greece but was actually Turkey. He also mentioned being beaten and threatened by Turkish border police in a previous attempt. The migrant declined to file an official complaint.
records.evidence_quote: They took their cell phones (around 6) and all the money they had (around 2000€). It was Turkey, not Greece, and they were arrested.

records.uncertainty_note: Specific location redacted, only border area (Bulgaria/Turkey) is known.

possible_violations.violation_name: SIR with suspected violation of fundamental rights/international protection obligations - BGR police allegedly returned migrants to TUR

records.context_note: An IRQ migrant claimed that Bulgarian police arrested him and other migrants, took their belongings (phones, jewels, sunglasses), and returned them to Turkey through a border fence. A police officer fired a shot in the air. The migrant expressed willingness to report officially.
records.evidence_quote: BGR police allegedly returned migrants to TUR

records.uncertainty_note: Specific facility redacted, but town (Elhovo) and country (Bulgaria) are known.
records.context_note: An Iraqi national, apprehended for carrying a forged passport, claimed a Bulgarian Border Police officer asked him for money (400$) to avoid passport control. When he said he only had 200$, the officer hit him (slaps and kicks). The migrant was then taken to BCP facilities. He declined to file an official complaint.
records.evidence_quote: the officer started hitting him (several slaps in his face and kicks in the back).

records.uncertainty_note: Specific location redacted, but town (Orestiada) and country (Greece) are known, near a trilateral border.
records.context_note: A Syrian national claimed to have crossed a river with his family near the trilateral border (Greece, Bulgaria, Turkey) and was apprehended. He provided information that 'appears to be a violation of Fundamental Rights'. It is unclear when and where the group was detected, and the interviewee could not identify the nationality of the officers who initially stopped them.
records.evidence_quote: the migrant provided information of what it appears to be a violation of Fundamental Rights.
